intro: Argyrolobium tuberosum, commonly known as the tuberous argyrolobium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features a distinctive appearance with its hairy, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its tuberous roots are notable for their swollen, fleshy structure, which serves as a storage organ. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
